newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE MONEY RATES STABLE IN WEDNESDAY TRADE.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE MONEY RATES STABLE IN WEDNESDAY TRADE.

text.p: Short-term trading rates on Zimbabwe's money market were quoted stable in quiet trade on Wednesday morning, dealers said.
"The market is fairly liquid, so there isn't much activity at the moment," one dealer said.
Treasury bills were being purchased from the central bank at 23.73 percent and re-sold on the market at 23.5 percent.

NCD bills maturing after 30, 60 and 90 days were being bought at rates ranging from 24.75 to 25 percent and sold between 24 and 24.5 percent, while bankers acceptance bills were quoted at 24 percent and 23.5 percent.
Call money fluctuated between 23 and 23.5 percent in a market which opened in surplus of Z$109 million, down from Tuesday's Z$760 million.
